channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.6 million, US deaths near 50,000 as Australia's death toll stands at 76

item.description: The combined wealth of America's billionaires, including Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos and Tesla chief Elon Musk, increased nearly 10 per cent since the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, a new study shows.
item.title: 'Tale of two pandemics': Billionaires' fortunes rise in COVID-19 lockdown

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: State's death toll stands at 6 as leaders expected to shed light on the first stage of easing social restrictions

item.description: Oil soared overnight, extending its rebound after major oil-producing nations said they would accelerate planned production cuts to combat the dramatic slump in demand due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Oil rallies as OPEC nations vow to accelerate output cuts

item.description: The S&P 500 ended marginally lower on Thursday after a report that an experimental antiviral drug for the coronavirus flopped in its first randomised clinical trial, denting optimism that the pandemic's impact on the labour market was nearing an end.
item.title: Wall Street trims gains after report on failed coronavirus drug trial

item.description: A first grim glimpse of situation came on March 23, when soldiers sent to disinfect nursing homes in Madrid found dozens of elderly people dead in their beds.
item.title: Half of coronavirus deaths in Europe linked to nursing homes, WHO says

item.description: Shares in US drugmaker Gilead Sciences were whipsawed for the second time in a week after a summary of a Chinese trial of its COVID-19 drug appeared to show that it was a failure.
item.title: Gilead shares tumble after data leak on coronavirus drug trials

item.description: Alexander Contreras said he was frustrated because he knew the clock was ticking and thought he might have to drop a class or even miss the whole school year.
item.title: El Salvador student takes to treetops to pick up signal for online classes

item.description: More evidence is emerging that far more New Yorkers have had the coronavirus than the number confirmed by lab tests, officials say.
item.title: Study finds nearly 14 per cent of New Yorkers may have been infected

item.description: "Your letter made my wife and I feel so wonderful!" Hanks wrote to the boy in a letter typed on a Corona typewriter which he had taken to the Gold Coast.
item.title: Tom Hanks sends letter to bullied Australian boy named Corona

item.description: More than 4.4 million laid-off workers applied for unemployment benefits in the US last week, bringing the total number of job losses from coronavirus to 26 million.
item.title: One in six American workers thrown out of a job by the coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: A mortgage broker allegedly involved in a horrific crash in which four police officers died spoke about his Porsche online and posted videos of the luxury cars.
item.title: Mortgage broker who allegedly left scene of horror crash posted Porsche videos online

item.description: Warren said that it was hard to know that "there was no family to hold his hand or to say 'I love you' one more time".
item.title: US Senator Elizabeth Warren's brother dies after contracting coronavirus

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The Berejiklian government will spend $73 million on a mental health package to help people cope during the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Mums reclaim their sleep with access to parenting app

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The prospect of a 50 per cent slump in revenue will raise eyebrows among investors.
item.title: Prospect of 50pc revenue slump at Seven will alarm investors

item.description: When business owners face life altering news, the instinct to maintain momentum is strong.
item.title: When entrepreneurs are seriously ill

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, April 24

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Ex-NSW Rugby chairman Nick Farr-Jones seems to have the putsch against Raelene Castle.
item.title: Wallabies great up for the challenge of RA's top job

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Residents will be able to install larger solar PV systems on roofs without council approval and NSW may get its first big battery as part of planning changes.
item.title: State government backs big batteries and solar to drive recovery

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The media empire controlled by billionaire Kerry Stokes has put its hand out for the government's JobKeeper wage subsidy to keep its thousands of workers employed.
item.title: Seven West Media puts hand out for JobKeeper in bid to save media jobs

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Sculpture by the Sea and Waverley Council have ended their fractious battle over the Bondi coastal walk.
item.title: Sculpture by the Sea set to stay in Bondi for at least five years

item.description: How does the 'economy' explain why I'm working fewer hours?
item.title: It's the economy, and you are not stupid

item.description: This weekend marks the 105th anniversary of the ANZAC landing at Gallipoli.This year also marks the 100th anniversary of the final year of the Spanish flu pandemic.
item.title: Lest we forget the woes of another time

item.description: Vigilance is needed on employer stand downs in response to COVID-19
item.title: Know your rights and stand up to unjustified staff stand downs

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Just 'cause the world's stopped, doesn't mean great music has.
item.title: Five new albums that are already coronavirus-era classics

item.dc:creator: Bob Carr
item.description: The US President's detractors call him idiotic, but Australia's former foreign affairs minister writes that it’s an idiocy of genius that has transformed the presidency.
item.title: Why Trump, the Bonaparte or our times, is likely to reign for another four years

item.description: Careers in animal protection offer a way for many professionals to use their skills for good.
item.title: People skills a valuable asset in helping animals

item.description: Sir David Martin was eight years old when his navy dad was killed at sea. He went on to become a warship captain and a NSW governor. His son, another navy man, writes this tribute.
item.title: My father's tears for his dad lost in battle: an Anzac reflection by Sir David Martin's son

item.description: On April 24, 1999, Arthur Boyd, one of Australia's greatest painters, died at the Mercy Hospital in Melbourne.
item.title: From the Archives, 1999: Arthur Boyd dies aged 78

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Loungeroom dance jams, a history of disability activism and a virtual reality journey into the human heart feature among the grants recipients.
item.title: Artists jump for joy as council awards COVID-19 arts grants

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Inaki Berroeta, who is set to lead a combined Vodafone-TPG, says the new player has the capacity to steal business customers from rivals Telstra and Optus.
item.title: Incoming Vodafone-TPG boss puts rivals on notice ahead of 'remote' merger

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: There are no options without risk but the priority should be to return children to their classrooms and end the inferior education of the computer screen.
item.title: Schools should be allowed to reopen soon - but with a caveat

item.dc:creator: Waleed Aly
item.description: We should take this chance to heed the warning from those nations that are presently unravelling.
item.title: Look at the US and the UK and be glad we're not like them

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 24, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A 2017 report containing a series of controversial policy recommendations has been dusted off as the government looks at fresh ideas to boost economic growth.
item.title: Micro-reforms from university fees to council red-tape to lift post-virus economy

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Australia records lowest number of COVID-19 cases in 24-hour period since early March, US death toll passes 46,000, Australia's death toll stands at 76

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: It comes as the sector braces for an exponential increase in people seeking help to manage their drinking due to the coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Boost to drug and alcohol service funding during COVID-19 pandemic

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Coronavirus will not stop Ralph Edwards from honouring the Anzacs this year.
item.title: Ralph the 101-year-old veteran to honour Anzacs in isolation

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, April 24

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Carlton's Madison Prespakis is one of AFLW's best players just two seasons after being drafted.
item.title: Carlton's Madison Prespakis dual best and fairest before turning 20

item.description: The finest photos from the wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: Police are desperate to understand how a routine traffic stop left four officers dead, but are also appalled that photographs and footage of their fallen colleagues were posted on social media within hours of their deaths.
item.title: Police desperate to make sense of tragic crash

item.description: The casts of old TV westerns quickly fill a vacuum.
item.title: Save the cheap stuff for your car's tank, not your own

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: What will be Australia’s tallest building, towering more than 360 metres above Melbourne’s CBD at Southbank, has been approved by the state Labor government.
item.title: Twisting tower to be Australia's tallest and a lifeline to the economy

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The coronavirus tracing app will get its own piece of legislation to ensure privacy concerns are dealt with.
item.title: New laws to cover coronavirus app after fears police could access data

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Sky Racing and Channel Seven have enjoyed massive spikes in viewership over the past two months as options for live sport remain restricted to horse racing.
item.title: Sky Racing, Seven enjoy racing ratings boost

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: 'I Do Drive Thru' was launched three weeks ago by four marriage celebrants and it expanded into Queensland this week.
item.title: Bride and vroom-vroom: Drive-through weddings launch in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Raelene Castle's resignation leaves Rugby Australia with a chasm to fill. One new director could be the person it looks to in the short term.
item.title: The mystery man who could step in to fill rugby's leadership void
